title: Introducing the A&A Signature Series
author: Alessandro Warwar
excerpt: We are excited to announce the launch of our latest guitar model, the A&A Signature Series.
content:
We are excited to announce the launch of our latest guitar model, the A&A Signature Series. This model features a unique blend of traditional craftsmanship and modern technology, offering unparalleled sound quality and playability.

Key Features

The Signature Series incorporates premium tonewoods, custom-wound pickups, and our proprietary neck construction technique for enhanced sustain and resonance.

Each guitar is meticulously crafted by our master luthiers, ensuring every detail meets our exacting standards. From the carefully selected maple neck to the custom-designed bridge system, every component is chosen for its contribution to the instrument's overall performance.

title: The Art of Guitar Maintenance
author: Anthony Romaniello
excerpt: Proper guitar maintenance is essential for preserving your instrument's tone and extending its lifespan.
content:
Proper guitar maintenance is essential for preserving your instrument's tone and extending its lifespan. In this comprehensive guide, we'll walk you through the essential steps every guitarist should know.

Daily Care Tips

Regular cleaning and proper storage can prevent most common guitar issues. Learn the techniques professionals use to keep their instruments in pristine condition.

Start by wiping down your strings after each playing session. Use a clean, dry cloth to remove oils and moisture that can cause corrosion. Store your guitar in a case or on a proper stand, away from direct sunlight and extreme temperatures.

title: Implementing the Light/Dark Mode Switcher
author: Alessandro Warwar
excerpt: A behind-the-scenes look at how we added a user-friendly light/dark mode toggle to our site.
content: For Part One, I wanted users to easily switch between light and dark modes. I wrote a changeMode() JavaScript function that toggles the darkMode and lightMode classes on the body element. I placed the toggle button in the navbar for visibility on every page. The function also updates the logo and icon images based on the mode. To remember the user's preference, I used cookies and checked them on page load to set the correct mode. In my CSS, I used selectors like .darkMode to change colors, backgrounds, and button styles for dark mode. One challenge was making sure the toggle button itself didn't get the dark mode button styling, so I excluded it with :not(.changeScreenModeIcon) in my CSS. This made the switch seamless and visually consistent across the site.

title: Building a Dynamic Blog Section
author: Anthony Romaniello
excerpt: How we made our blog section dynamic using JSON and JavaScript.
content: For Part Two, I wanted the blog to be easy to update without editing HTML. I created a Posts.json file to store all blog post data as an array of objects. Each object contains fields like id, title, author, date, excerpt, and content. In my JavaScript, I used fetch() to load Posts.json and then looped through the posts to generate HTML for each one. I inserted the generated HTML into the blog container on the page. This lets me add or edit posts just by updating the JSON file. I also added logic to only display posts where published is true. This approach keeps the blog scalable and easy to maintain, and separates content from layout and logic.
